title: How does a criticism effect a writer's style? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on a few facts:— If the stuff of writer is good critic should appreciate. So if the criticism is constructive with a few suggestions alongside of appreciation the writer feel satisfied. If the writer's material is not so good and gets unjustified appreciation the writer may get high opinion of himself and may not try to improve. Some writers go on their way of writing if they are confident justifiably. They may or may not respond to criticism Some writers who are not serious about criticism , which firms the larger chunk of writers may not survive in competition of the present-day flooding of books.

When you publish a book you open yourself to criticism. You need to harden yourself to criticism, good or bad. Constructive criticism can be helpful, but you need to throw away/forget destructive criticism which is just trying to make you feel insecure.
